com.apigee.sdk.data.client
Class ApigeeDataClient

java.lang.Object
  com.apigee.sdk.data.client.ApigeeDataClient

public class ApigeeDataClient
extends java.lang.Object

The DataClient class for accessing the API BaaS API. Start by instantiating this class though the appropriate constructor. Most calls to the API will be handled by the methods in this class.

See Also:
ApigeeClient, Apigee SDK install guide

assignPermissions

public ApiResponse assignPermissions(java.lang.String entityType,
                                     java.lang.String entityID,
                                     java.lang.String permissions)
Assigns permissions to the specified user, group, or role.

Parameters:
entityType - the entity type of the entity the permissions are being assigned to. 'user', 'group' and 'role' are valid.
entityID - the UUID of 'name' property of the entity the permissions are being assigned to.
permissions - a comma-separated list of the permissions to be assigned in the format: :, e.g. get, put, post, delete: /users
Returns:
ApiResponse object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if an entityType other than 'group' or 'user' is passed to the method

                                   java.lang.String permissions,
                                   ApiResponseCallback callback)

Parameters:

entityID - the UUID of 'name' property of the entity the permissions are being assigned to.
permissions - a comma-separated list of the permissions to be assigned in the format: :, e.g. get, put, post, delete: /users
callback - an ApiResponseCallback to handle the async response

registerDeviceForPush

public Device registerDeviceForPush(java.util.UUID deviceId,
                                    java.lang.String notifier,
                                    java.lang.String token,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
Registers a device for push notifications using the device entity UUID. If the device does not have an associated entity, pass DataClient.getUniqueDeviceID() and one will be created.

Parameters:
deviceId - the UUID of the device entity associated with this device
notifier - the 'name' property of the notifier that will be used to send notifications to this device
token - the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) API key. Should be the same as the API key saved in the notifier entity.
properties - additional properties to be stored in the device entity
Returns:
a Device object if success

registerDeviceForPushAsync

public void registerDeviceForPushAsync(java.util.UUID deviceId,
                                       java.lang.String notifier,
                                       java.lang.String token,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                                       DeviceRegistrationCallback callback)
Registers a device for push notifications using the device entity UUID. If the device does not have an associated entity, pass DataClient.getUniqueDeviceID() and one will be created. Executes asynchronously in background and the callbacks are called in the UI thread.

Parameters:
deviceId - the UUID of the device entity associated with this device
notifier - the 'name' property of the notifier that will be used to send notifications to this device
token - the Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) API key. Should be the same as the API key saved in the notifier entity.
properties - additional properties to be stored in the device entity
callback - a DeviceRegistrationCallback to handle the async response

Parameters:
payload - the push notification payload
destination - the destination for the push notification. Can be a single device entity, set of devices, or all devices. For more information, see GCMDestination.
notifier - the 'name' property of the notifier entity to be used to send the notification
Returns:
ApiResponse object from the notification entity creation
See Also:
GCMPayload, GCMDestination

pushNotificationAsync

public void pushNotificationAsync(GCMPayload payload,
                                  GCMDestination destination,
                                  java.lang.String notifier,
                                  ApiResponseCallback callback)
Creates a notification entity and sends a push notification asynchronously.

Parameters:
payload - the push notification payload
destination - the destination for the push notification. Can be a single device entity, set of devices, or all devices. For more information, see GCMDestination.
notifier - the 'name' property of the notifier entity to be used to send the notification
callback - A callback for the async response

GCMPayload, GCMDestination

                                                                   java.lang.String connectionType,
                                                                   float distance,
                                                                   float latitude,
                                                                   float longitude,
                                                                   java.lang.String ql)

longitude - The longitude of the ponit from which to measure distance.

registerDevice

public Device registerDevice(java.util.UUID deviceId,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
Creates or updates a device entity using the provided deviceId, and saves the device model, device platform, and OS version in the entity. If an entity does not exist for the device, it is created with a UUID equal to deviceId.

Parameters:
deviceId - the device entity's UUID
properties - additional properties to save in the device entity.
Returns:
a Device object if success. Models the API BaaS device entity.

registerDeviceAsync

public void registerDeviceAsync(java.util.UUID deviceId,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                                DeviceRegistrationCallback callback)
Creates or updates a device entity using the provided deviceId, and saves the device model, device platform, and OS version in the entity. If an entity does not exist for the device, it is created with a UUID equal to deviceId. Executes asynchronously in background and the callbacks are called in the UI thread.

Parameters:
deviceId - the device entity's UUID
properties - additional properties to save in the device entity
callback - a DeviceRegistrationCallback to handle the async response

getCountersForInterval

public ApiResponse getCountersForInterval(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> counterArray,
                                          java.util.Date startTime,
                                          java.util.Date endTime,
                                          java.lang.String resolution)
Requests one or more counters for a given time inteval and resolution, e.g. day, hour, etc.

Parameters:
counterArray - an ArrayList of counter names to be retrieved
startTime - a Date object specifying the start time to retrieve counter data for
endTime - a Date object specifying the end time to retrieve counter data for
resolution - the resolution of the result set. Results can be returned for the following: all, minute, five_minutes, half_hour, hour, day, six_day, week, month
callback - an ApiResponseCallback to handle the async response
Returns:
an ApiResponse object

storeOAuth2TokenData

public java.lang.Boolean storeOAuth2TokenData(java.lang.String storageId,
                                              TokenResponse tokenResponse)
Stores the given OAuth 2 token response within a file data store. The stored token response can then retrieved using the getOAuth2TokenDataFromStore method.

Parameters:
storageId - a string object that is used to store the token response
tokenResponse - the token response containing the OAuth 2 token information.
Returns:
If the token response was stored or not.

getOAuth2TokenDataFromStore

public TokenResponse getOAuth2TokenDataFromStore(java.lang.String storageId)
Retrieves the stored token response that corresponds to the given storageId.

Parameters:
storageId - the id used to store the TokenResponse
Returns:
The TokenResponse object that is associated with the given storageId or null if no TokenResponse was found.

deleteStoredOAuth2TokenData

public void deleteStoredOAuth2TokenData(java.lang.String storageId)
Deletes the TokenResponse that is associated with the given storageId from the file data store.

Parameters:
storageId - The storageId associated with the stored TokenResponse.

                                   java.lang.String clientId,
                                   java.lang.String clientSecret,

clientId - The client_id
clientSecret - The client_secret
callback - The callback that will be executed when we have finished.

oauth2AccessToken

                                       java.lang.String clientId,
                                       java.lang.String clientSecret)
Used to get an OAuth 2 access_token using the client_credentials grant_type synchronously.

Parameters:
accessTokenURL - The url used to get the access_token
clientId - The client_id
clientSecret - The client_secret
Returns:
The TokenResponse object if we successfully gathered the token or null if the attempt was not successful.

oauth2AccessTokenAuthorizationCodeIntent

public Intent oauth2AccessTokenAuthorizationCodeIntent(Context context,
                                                       java.lang.String authorizationCodeURL,
                                                       java.lang.String accessTokenURL,
                                                       java.lang.String redirectURL,
                                                       java.lang.String clientId,
                                                       java.lang.String clientSecret)

authorizationCodeURL - the authorizationCodeURL
accessTokenURL - the accessTokenURL
redirectURL - the redirectURL
clientId - the clientId
clientSecret - the clientSecret
Returns:
the created Intent
